data.text:
2. WOODGROVE BANK 2 Table of Contents • Geographical conditions • Demographics • Culture and base Map • Gram Panchayat • Livelihood • Energy sector • Education • Health and Sanitation • Agriculture • Evaluated schemes of the village • Suggestions

3. WOODGROVE BANK • Aralaguppe is a Gram Panchayat which comes under Tiptur taluk/block of Tumakuru district in south interior Karnataka. • Aralaguppe is situated on a flat land having soil type of red sandy loam. • Aralaguppe is part of coconut hinterland and is very much involved in coconut cultivation • Aralaguppe receives rainfall from the month of April to October, April to July receives moderate rainfall of 160 mm. July till October receives heavy rain of around 300 mm annually. 3 GEOGRAPHICAL CONDITIONS

4. WOODGROVE BANK • The total number of households in Aralaguppe was 595 in 2011 with a total population of 2247. • We can observe that, there is a remarkable change in sex ratio from 975 to 1046. • The literacy rate has gone up by just 1 % for males, it is 17% for females. 4 DEMOGRAPHICS

5. WOODGROVE BANK • Aralaguppe is also famous for its art and culture. • The traditional dance form is Yakshagana, there are a few Yakshagana trainers who not only teach many students within the village but also teach in surrounding villages. • There is also knowledge of many other cultural traditions like Veeragaase. • All these art forms have been rendered by the villagers in places like Bengaluru and other cities. 5 CULTUREAND BASE MAP

6. WOODGROVE BANK • Map brings out the entire layout of the village. • Various village institutions like Gram Panchayat, temple, community hall, railway station, shops, are depicted in the social map. • Aralaguppe’s diverse resources like lakes, wells and borewells,are also depicted in the map. 6 CULTUREAND BASE MAP

7. WOODGROVE BANK • Aralaguppe Gram Panchayat has six villages and thirteen habitations under its purview. • It consists of 9 members • The GP elections happen once in every five year, To ensure equal justice to all class and caste, specific reservation policies are implemented. The Sarpanch post is reserved for ST/Women candidate. Also, 50% seats are reserved for women candidates. • The village gram panchayat even has a biometric attendance system. The broad role and responsibilities of Gram Panchayat are listed below:  Maintain various public infrastructure of the villa  Ensure proper health and hygiene in the village  Ensure primary education available to all children  Implement the schemes 7 GRAM PANCHAYAT

8. WOODGROVE BANK • The major source of income in Aralaguppe is agriculture and agricultural labour. Non-agricultural livelihoods • Brick making • Leaf plate making • Basket making • Tailoring 8 LIVELIHOOD

9. WOODGROVE BANK • The availability of 24 hours of electricity due to a government scheme called Niranthara Jyothi. • The total electrical energy consumption for Aralaguppe village is 168.7 MWH. • There was no significant usage of renewable energy sources like solar, hydro or wind. Only one street lamp out of 9 was solar. There was only one biogas unit in entire village. • For cooking purpose,villagers mainly used firewood and dung cake as the major source of fuel. 9 ENERGY SECTOR

10. WOODGROVE BANK • There are two Anganwadis in the Aralaguppe village. The Anganwadi including the kitchen is well maintained. • The primary school established in 1896 has standard first to seventh. The primary school has a midday meal scheme. • The High school established in 1892 has standards eight up to ten. • 389 out of 1799 are illiterate in Aralaguppe. In Aralaguppe male literacy stands at 91.04 % while female literacy rate is 77.68 %. 10 EDUCATION

11. WOODGROVE BANK • Aralaguppe had a primary health centre which was constructed in 1995,in 2012 a modernized PHC was built. • The hospital has six beds and seven personnel working as medical officer, nurse, pharmacist, male and female junior health assistant,laboratory analyst and an administrative officer. • The major diseases encountered in Aralaguppe are Dengue, TB, Chikungunya and Malaria. The prevalence of these diseases has reduced drastically and has not been reported lately. 11 HEALTH AND SANITATION

12. WOODGROVE BANK • A total of 61 households out of 83 household had toilets. All the households which had toilets also had soak pits. • Based on caste, the numbers of households belonging to general, OBC, SC and ST communities were 11 households, 4 households, 4 households and 3 households. • In terms of garbage disposal, most of Aralaguppe’s organic wastes like vegetable wastes go to livestock and cow dung goes to farmland as manure. • However disposal of inorganic wastes like plastics and glass is a huge problem. 12 HEALTH AND SANITATION

13. WOODGROVE BANK • The major source of income in Aralaguppe is agriculture and agricultural labour. • People either work in their own farm land or as labourers in land belonging to others. • Nearly 60% of the villagers solely practice agriculture. Most of the women also join in as labour in agricultural activities. • Out of the 83 households, 48 households are solely dependent on agriculture. 13 AGRICULTURE

14. WOODGROVE BANK • Public Water Supply Scheme • The Aralaguppe Gram Panchayat manages water supply schemes in 13 habitations belonging to six villages in its jurisdiction. • Aralaguppe is fully covered with piped water supply scheme with 448 household connections. • There have been a number of schemes for mother and child care like National Health Mission, Janani Suraksha Yojane, Madilu Yojane and Prasuti Haraike Yojane. Through these schemes a certain fixed amount of money is offered for the birth giving mother during delivery. • The process of building toilets has gained pace with schemes like MGNREGA, Nirmal Bharat Abhiyan and now the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan. 14 EVALUATED SCHEMES

15. WOODGROVE BANK • Sanitation continues to be a problem with nearly 30% households lacking toilets. Hence the construction of individual toilets under Swachh Bharat Abhiyan ought to continue. • Water conservation techniques like rainwater harvesting, watershed management and drip irrigation could be promoted. • In the education sector, there is a need for English medium schools. • A Pre-University College (covering Arts, Science and Commerce) can be set up in Aralaguppe so that it would help students of Aralaguppe and surrounding villages. • New jobs for men are also recommended since stand-alone agriculture is no longer profitable. The youth should be motivated with good jobs so that they do not migrate to cities to avoid crisis. • A veterinary hospital is required to be established in Aralaguppe so that people having sheep, goats and cattle can have peace of mind when their animals are in trouble. • There should be a mechanism of collection of non-biodegradable wastes like plastics, glass, etc. which is now not being done. 15 SUGGESTIONS
